result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ROSEMARY A SANDLEY

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant ROSEMARY A SANDLEY in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for ROSEMARY A SANDLEY.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties agree competency exam is appropriate.
Court orders competency exam.  Bond continued.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ROSEMARY A SANDLEY in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for ROSEMARY A SANDLEY. 
Court will hear testimony for both preliminary hearings in 21CF710 & 22CF316 at the same time. 
Officer Helstern sworn and testifies. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Exhibit #1 offered and received. 
Exhibit #2 offered and received. 
ADA Yohnk requests documents to be sealed. 
ADA Yohnk requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in 21CF710.
Attorney Field cross-examines witness. 
ADA Yohnk redirects witness. 
Court questions witness. 

Court finds probable cause in 21CF710 & 22CF316 and binds defendant over for further proceedings. 
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Off record: Court orders Exhibits #1 and #2 to be sealed and access given to the parties. 

The original document was titled: Exhibit #1
The original history event date is: 08-15-2022
The original document was titled: Exhibit #2
The original history event date is: 08-15-2022

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ROSEMARY A SANDLEY in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for ROSEMARY A SANDLEY. 
22CF316:  Attorney waives reading of complaint.  Defendant is informed of charges.  Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
No resolution. To be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing. Bond continued.

BOND COVERS NEW (MODIFIED) AND NEW
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
No contact with Victim 1. their residence, or the dog that was at the residence prior to the current charge.

Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ROSEMARY A SANDLEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dailey Johnson appeared by video for ROSEMARY A SANDLEY.
